api_list.name: Subtitle
api_list.description:
Fetch YouTube video caption/subtitle by channel Id

Default format will be JSON

You can get Caption Subtitles .srt format as well

captions.text: breaking tonight at 11 the palisades
fire explodes forcing mandatory
evacuations the blaze broke out in a
remote area off
michael lane in palisades court last
night firefighters worked through the
night last night to try and contain the
flames they might have to do so again
tonight this evening a flare-up that got
out of hand eyewitness news reporter amy
powell is live in pacific palisades
tonight
with the sky glowing behind you amy
how's it looking
well it's certainly not looking good
right now joy and veronica
mandatory evacuation orders have been
given to residents of
about 500 homes in the topanga canyon
area
and as you can see this massive blaze
continues to tear through the
terrain tonight it's burning extremely
rugged terrain an investigation is
continuing but firefighters say this
could be the result
of arson the glow of flames
lighting up the sky as helicopters fly
through the smoky haze
dropping loads of water on the fire
tearing through the hillsides
the enormous blaze now threatening
hundreds of homes
in the topanga canyon area now it's
flaming up and it's getting pretty close
to our neighborhood
so i have a one-year-old a two-year-old
in the in the car so i
i have to evacuate now so we do have uh
multiple fire engines and several strike
teams in fact up there
uh positioned in a structured defense
posture
um and they're gonna be there on standby
in case that fire does start impinging
on those homes the fire broke out around
10 last night
and has grown dramatically burning in
steep rugged terrain
and destroying more than 750 acres
a lot of the fuels in there haven't
burned in 50 plus years
so we're looking at pretty dense heavy
fuels as well
fire crews bringing in several
helicopters to battle the blaze from the
air
dumping retardant and water on the
flames
the thick layer of smoke visible for
miles
residents in the fire zone sharing video
of the flames burning near their homes
residents of pacific palisades on edge
tonight
keeping an eye on the fire as it
destroys vegetation on nearby ridges
it's been a little bit crazy for the
last almost 24 hours now but
we were here i think in 2019 when the
fire was on palisades drive
and i'm just really thankful for the
amazing firefighters police department
it's uh unsettling definitely it's hard
to sleep
the helicopter's been going since 10
o'clock last night so last night didn't
seem bad at all and then today
looking at that yeah that's crazy
the firefighters are hoping to help get
some help from the weather conditions
overnight but right now they have zero
containment on this blaze
and from what you can see it doesn't
appear that it's slowing down hello i'm
mark brown
get more great abc 7 content by clicking
the subscribe button for our youtube
channel
and download the abc 7 los angeles
streaming app on fire tv
android tv apple tv and roku to watch on
your tv

api_list.name: Channel Info
api_list.description: YouTube channel information by channel id

data.author: Automation Step by Step
data.description:
Raghav is a teacher and founder of AutomationStepByStep.com
He was an Automation Architect and has led multiple teams of Automation and DevOps Engineers. For over a decade, Raghav witnessed, worked, and delivered multiple Automation Testing Projects and worked with some awesome people in this industry.
Today he teaches Automation, Testing, DevOps and CI.
He is also a coach and trainer and conducts classes in India and the US. 

Words from Raghav
We often need someone to hold our hand and help us take the first few steps before we learn to walk and run. I am on a mission to spread education and make it available to anyone willing to learn.

Never stop learning‚Ä¶
Raghav Pal

All education here is FREE FOR ALL, FOREVER.
https://automationstepbystep.com/

Once you get the knowledge, do share with as many people as you can in your lifetime.

api_list.name: Comments
api_list.description: YouTube video comments list by channel id
body: Man, that tutorial is great, I absolutely love how clear everything is.
Lot of respect for people like you who put efforts and invest time to make our life easier. Thanks a ton.
Needed to fast-track the install and this was very useful - thanks sir!
Hey Raghav, Thanks for the great tutorial.. apart from CL can we use the visual studio directly in order to push or pull the project into the gitlab? please comment
this is a awesome tutorial, best that i've found on youtube, every step is explained clearly, thank you for the work
I learned more today than what I used to learn in a 2 week sprint. Thank you, Raghav :-)
I was looking to a couple of tutorials and didnt get anything clear. This one saved my life in 15 mins thank you!
When I look at all your videos, All I found was your great knowledge and a passion to train others. a great big like for you darlin.
Wow, this was OUTSTANDING, when you're a completely new to this stuff like me and have no idea where to start, this was absolutely perfect!! THANKS!
After many hours of searching and frustration I finally land on this tutorial which made my night much better. Thanks a million!
Easy, simple and smooth! Well explained!
Hey Raghav. You made the steps so easy to follow and understand. Thank you for the tutorial. Looking forward to learning more from you.
This was a great help Raghav :-)
best tutorials ever! i m glad I found your channel
You're the first tutorial that shows installation on both unix and windows, thanks so much!
Raghav thank you so much for this tutorial. You  saved me, greetings from Costa Rica
Great video. This is true Beginner Tutorial. Keep up the good work in organizing and presentation
Thank you so much! It  helped me a lot.
Wow.  This tutorial is awesome. You just explained all things to the detail. Please keep up the work ure great!
great video - step by step, adding redundancies so people are clear on all your instructions. Thank you!
Appreciate your efforts dear..I am very new to GitLab and these small small tutorials save so much of our time to work on the biggerchallenges. Many thanks.
Thank you so much for these videos. Please keep it up.
I love your calmness and the way you teach, your videos have really helped me. Thank you very much.
Amazingly Explained and that too very clear and word to word..Great efforts
Beautifully explained. Thank so much for this useful video and contribution to the tech community!!

Thank you very much! Your video is so much HELPFUL!!! It's very clear and resonable. I was compeletely overwhealmed by my professors' misleading video. His Dutch-English is so bad and his 10 min video cost me nearly 3 hours to figure it out, but still give up in the end. I have never thought Git was so much easy before. Thanks for your videos and lectures again!
Very clearly laid out the steps, true master. Many thanks for the video.
One of the best tutorial channel in YouTube I have ever seen. All steps are clearly shown and excellently explained. Well done, it makes lives of many developers easier
Great work Raghav, really enjoy your videos.  Very clear with great explanations and examples.
Hey Raghav, Thank you for the tutorial. Really helpful. Is there a video to show us to switch between master and different branches and how to check-in to a branche?
It is really helpful.Thank you sir..

Apart from your teaching another thing which is amazing here is that your accent of speaking english is very fluent and easy to understand specially for people who dont have english as there primary language .
Awesome tutorial, Thanks Raghav for changing many lifes
Thank you for putting this step by step tutorial.

I'm really thankful for this video and your efforts in making difficult things easier for me. It has really helped me and i was able to push my first project to Gitlab. I'm so happy and grateful for your help.....Thanks so much and may God bless you.
Great work. Its so smooth to follow along with you.
Very good presentation. I'm a beginner and was able to understand each point very well.Thank you for sharing such an tutorial.
Very informative. Keep up the good work!!!
thank you very much! your videos are very helpful!

Hi thank you for the great video series! I was able to follow the instructions very well but I made a mistake on entering the password while trying to push the changes now I keep getting the error "remote: HTTP Basic: Access denied fatal: Authentication failed for  ..." No matter what I do  the password window doesnt prompt me to reenter password. Please Help
Hello Raghav, Thank  you for this tutorial..I am getting an error while running  push code in office server and the error msg is Failed to push some refs to "
"  and i tired this three times using different different location but i could not able to resolve this issue. Can you please help me on this?
Thanks, Raghav. It works. I successfully pushed files to Gitlab.
Thank you very much for these videos!
wish i had four hands to salute you four times...thanks a lot sir. god bless you..may he bring progress and prosperity in your life.. may your life be filled with his love..
Thank you so much Raghav,your videos helped me a lot.
Awesome explanation....hats off to you sir.

Super  and Very clear explanation!!!... As a beginner , it was very helped to me.. Thank you so much! Can you please start to do coding as well like "React js","Node js"like that... You have explained very well!!..
i followed yours as it is...it went awsome..thank you so much guruji..
CMD in the address bar of a folder is a super helpful tip! Niiiiice.

Hi Raghav.. Thank you for your effort. Please try to make some more videos on Gitlab...because we have very less gitlab tutorials available on youtube. presently most of the companies are using gitlab. hope you will consider my request. Thank you. keep going well.
Thanks for tutorial. Can we add custom field in the project create page?
Hey Raghav, thanks for the tutorial.I entered my credentials for the push command and http authentication failed. How to re-enter my credentials again?
Great video tutorial! thank you Raghav
For us you are doing greate work,Thanks a lot

Great! A real master. Thank you! I had problem. I was able to reach this stage:   git add .     I runned the commands (ubuntu 16.04).     git push -u ‚Äúurl‚Äù master, returned: "fatal: protocol '‚Äúhttps' is not supported"
I'm a member of the project
your tutorial was amazing Thank you so much for this video.Thanks Alot
kindly upload that how we transfer or move our project from one cloud server to another cloud based server.

Hello Raghav, I saw your tutorials on on Gitlab, it was very helpful. There is one thing I need to ask, that if I want to use two accounts for managing gitlab repositories for different projects. The gitlab account for both the repositories  are different. How can we set two different global user name for two different projects? Can you please clarify, how can we tackle this situation?
Hi Raghav, thanks for this tutorial it's really great.
I have question : I am trying to install  Git-2.29.2.2-64-bit in Windows machine, and it fails.The error message is : ShellExecuteEx failed ; code -2147221003.Application introuvable.
I don't know how solve this problem.
of course Raghav this  was very useful, and to the point
Hi Raghav Thank you so much bro..I have small help here How do we connect git local to git remote project
if You type in Windows Explorator folder in address bar 'cmd' and hit Enter key, a Command Line Tool will open-up with CWD with was in address of active folder. :)

Thank you very much for all the tutorials. You sharing your knowledge is very helpful for many people including me.


I have one question here. What is sugnificance of -u option in the push command?


Thanks in advance üôÇ
Please make a database testing series as its also very helpful for us and yours tutorials are awesome, easy to understand.
Thank you so much for the informative Video.
Is there a way that I can rollback a committed file? If I dont want the file to be pushed to Remote repository?
Also Is there anyway that I can ignore some files(.jar files for example) from getting tracked, to be committed?
Hi Raghav, good clarity. A suggestion to add about "Add SSH key" in Gitlab
very clear and concise looking forward to learning from you Raghav
Where did you run the gitlab server from, Your workstation or a Server?
If you observe this error on Windows "git is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file."
You need to set environment variable as explained here -
Great tutorial! I created another branch. How can I work on it? My plan is to later merge it into the master.

Hey, I have one question. How can we do push and get URI link for Merge request in console so that to press the link and navigate immediately to form of merge request? couldnt find any guide for this. Thanks.
Don't know why people waste time on TikTok and other Scrap content. where you can learn Tons of things from a Good content maker like you.
Hey bro. It is a great help it helps me a lot. God bless you

Hi Raghav. Great courses thanks. I look forward to some live Hangout course when they arrive. I'm following your Git, LWC,Mulesoft and Postman videos too. In general, we need to understand the CLI. But, what's the difference between CLI for example in VS Code, Command Line on the Machine or the Special Windows Installed Command Line in Git Bash?
Thank you Sir, please i had this error when pushing the project
fatal: unable to access 'project link': The requested URL returned error: 403
I added my user to the project members and i faced the same error
what is the tool or application that you have used for screen recording in mac and windows.
but I'm getting an error when trying to push the changes
it says "fatal : unable to access 'myUrl' : failed to connect to
the changes are a fresh laravel installation , how to solve this please?
Hai sir... I want to small clarification about branch
What is branch and how to tell the interview point of time about branch

Hi Raghav. Really cool video and very detailed. I worked with GitHub before and now exploring GitLab. I use Mac and encountered an issue. In terminal I cant switch to GitLab - I simply do not know how. I know that I can run GH and GL on one machine with terminal. But how to set up it. Any help here?
Thanks Raghav for all your information
thank you for all your awesome tutorials
but just could not execute this commands...  would you happened to know why?

I really wonder, since all the operations can be done even without using command line, directly through eclipse and it is so easy, then why everyone focusses on giving command through cmd?  Please let me know y commiting /clonning through eclipse options is not popular?
Straight  and simple explanation,excellent Raghav sir
I am from Bangladesh. First time I watched your video. You are the best. Your teaching style and voice is best i have ever watched videos on youtube. Thanks a lot
very clear, thanks a lot Radhav. and can i ask you a question, how can i delete 2 commits that i create accidentally (first time i didnt know how to work on gitlab). looking forward your answer
Hello Sir, Do you have any videos for GitLab Linux? Is this commands same for Linux OS too?
Hi Raghav, I entered wrong password and now it gives me a http error all the time, how to resolve this.
Hope this is possible on Linux also Raghav??
This Gitlab tutorial are very useful for me as I am working on an Admin side of CI Gitlab, could you please touch some admin related tasks towards using gitlab. Thanks

HI Raghav ,Its was very help full ,Could you please let us kno wdifference between Git lab  and git hub. Will git lab is secured ?  For client  projects purpose which type of edition we should use .Could you please let me know the same.Thank you somuch
Hi Raghav, I keep getting a "fatal: invalid refspec" error with git push commands, any idea why?
Hi Raghav, thank you for creating such videos and its really helpful for novice techies like me. I am getting fatal authentication error while pushing to gitlab. Please suggest how to resolve.
I am signing in through github account. I have removed credentials from windows credentials manager too. However still issue is persisting
I had to add my local
key to GitLab, under User Settings -> SSH Keys. After that I did the command git push -u origin master and it worked. Thanks for the tutorial!
Thanks  man!  you make my day... but what about branches?
How do you switch from windows to mac and vice versa?

With "git push...." what happens if the files were already there on GitHub URL location?  Will those be over written?  Will the delete (file removed from local) be also removed from GitHub URL location?
Hello, firstly Thank you for the great tutorial. I got all the way to the part were I am pushing my changes to master, and I get an authentication error.   remote: HTTP Basic: Access denied
possible I typed in the wrong username, but how can I retry? When I run the push command again, it doesn't prompt me for the credentials anymore, it just denies it automatically.
Hi Raghav, Thanks for such a wonderful content.
Issue here: getting error while pushing the code change from local git bash
SSL certificate problem: unable to get local issuer certificate
Thanks Raghav, Actually I am new to Git,your videos are really useful.I am really appreciate your efforts.I have a question.We have a project repository in GitLab enterprise

license expired.can we either move to Community edition or same enterprise edition downgrade to Community edition.which is the right approach? Could you please explain me? Even if you give any video it will useful to many people like me.Thanks again.
Did he use macOS and windowsOS at the same time? Was it virtual machine?
hi Raghav, Nice Video! but can you help to integrate git lab with databricks
What if you have the same username and email on both GitHub and GitLab?
